title: Which mistake can we avoid while preparing for the JEE Mains and Advanced? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well Everyone will Tell you about their Mistakes like They didn't Study enough or Weren't Dedicated enough but that isn't the Problem that matters in the Long term in JEE preparation. JEE being a Competitive exams also have some Bad After Effects on Mental Health and causes Anxiety. Here are Some mistakes you can Avoid while Preparing for JEE:- Focus more on your Mental Health- Just because no one Talks about this issue doesn't mean this isn't a real one, Mental Health is a very Important Factor in our life and Trust me it can Effect your Preparation severally, Some Things you can do to avoid Depression and Anxiety are:- Take Frequent walks, Talk to Friends Regularly, Eat Healthy and Don't Skip Meals. Don't Take School for Granted and Try to Go as Less as you can- If you Really are Sincere about your JEE preparation Try to Avoid going to school as It won't be any helpful, School Wont teach you any stuff Usefull for JEE but only Suck Talent outta you Like a Leach.Try To give as Much Mock Tests as You can- Giving Mock Test won't only Show you where you stand amongst your peers but also Will Help you in Becoming comfortable with sitting for a specific time and Increasing your Comfort with Solving exams, So when you give Real Exams it doesn't seem and Different from Giving Tests and You Dont Become Nervous. Solve some Quality books Along with the Chapter you are Studying- Try to Solve some Quality Books like Cengage along your Chapter Preparation so that it doesn't become a Burden For Later.Make Quality Notes- First of all i would like to point out that Making notes in the Form you Understand is Important, Notes should Have Nostalgia with them, Like whenever you read Them you can Remember what You were while Studying that topic, And Don't Borrow or use Someone's Notes as Everyone Understands it Different. Hope You Like my answer 👍

There are MANY things which can aspirant needs to take care of while preparing for IIT JEE.. (Please follow my complete IIT JEE Guide for details).. But one thing which is like one of the biggest blunders done by various aspirants is, people keep running after different test series and modules and dont focus on previous year IIT JEE Questions, which is the most imp thing to be done!) Whatever you do in the 2–3 years of preparation for JEE… But mastering Previous Year Questions for PCM is MUST !! one must master each and every question of it.. (You can use Arihant 40 years for that).. After doing this, you can do anything you want.. But only after that :) Best Wishes :)
